page.title: 13SOUNDBOROUGH,SEVENHAMPTON
page.content: Soundborough stands picturesquely in a fold of the hills surrounded by its farm buildings and 3 cottages .The estate having changed hands 6 years ago in 1985 the house is undergoing extensive refurbishment and enlargement.It is a flourishing mixed farm with 90 hectares of grass, supporting nearly 85 ewes and 224 hectares of arable.There is also some woodland for which there is a gradual longterm replanting programme. On the edge of the estate there is a pair of cottages bought by the council to avoid their becoming derelict at a time when low rents made maintenance uneconomic;they are now being sold to their council tenants.All those living on the estate also work there.The previous farmer is retired nearby ,where his family farm a smaller holding.
